content:
3.46 
Legal consequences of the annulment of a marriage where one or both spouses were dishonest 
1. Where only one of the spouses was honest, the nullity of the marriage shall confer on him or her the rights recognised for the spouse.
2. If both spouses were dishonest, the void marriage does not create for them rights and obligations as spouses. Each of them has the right to take back his or her property, including that which has been given to the other spouse.
